column1: New Delhi is the capital city of India and the seat of all three branches of the Government of India.
The Taj Mahal, located in Agra, is an ivory-white marble mausoleum and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
The Indian subcontinent is the birthplace of four major world religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
The Himalayas, the world's highest mountain range, are located in the northern part of India.
The Ganges is a sacred river and a lifeline to millions of Indians who live along its course.
India gained independence from British rule on August 15, 1947, led by figures like Mahatma Gandhi.
Bollywood, based in Mumbai, is known for producing a large number of films annually.
Indian cuisine is known for its diverse range of flavors and spices.
India is the world's largest democracy, with a federal structure comprising states and union territories.
Cricket is one of the most popular sports in India, with a team that has won multiple world championships.
